Andy Boyko wrote:
> Congratulations & I'm sorry on Heritrix making Slashdot today.  In 
> classic Slashdot style, they got a key detail wrong (Heritrix != 
> Wayback).  But that leads to the question: is there any intent to 
> release the Wayback Machine code as well, or are you guys cooking up a 
> revised Wayback too?

Thanks! Slashdot attention often comes a little earlier than ideal,
but we'll take it. :)

Thw WM is older code of a different pedigree (Perl & C and Alexa
authorship) that probably won't be open-sourced anytime soon. We
might get around to a Java-based updating of that functionality
at some point, which would probably be open source.

In the meantime, the NWA (Nordic Web Archive) has the first
version of their toolset available for download under the GPL:

   http://nwa.nb.no/

It's better than the WM in several respects: full-text search and
a top-of-window "timeline" showing ticks where each page capture
occurred.

There's no existing tool to coerce Heritrix ARCs into the NWA Toolset
import format -- but we'd love to host such a tool in our project, if
anyone writes it.

- Gordon @ IArchive
